content.description: Start on the right side of the west face by making a huge step onto a foot rail and grabbing the top (or whatever you can reach). This is a height-dependent problem and if you're tall enough, can be done without climbing shoes. If you're not as tall to reach the top lip, the problem will be noticeably more difficult.
content.protection: Pad. Good landing and a short problem, though.
content.location: Down climb is on the east face through the trees. Reference pictures and map for exact details.

content.description: Start on a right hand undercling and a left hand side pull crimp. Move up the delicate face using the crimps to a sloper top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. Great landing.
content.location: The route starts on the right side of the west face. There is a down climb on the east side.

climbs.name: The Pope Walks Into a Bar

content.description: Starting on the small rail on the left side of the boulder (with positive feet), move up and right in a crescent shape, staying away from the gigantic rail to the left.
content.location: Reference picture for more details. there is a down climb on the east side of the boulder in through a small tree.

content.description:
Squat start on the north face of the Papacy Block on a positive vertical rail. Utilizing the face crimps and the right arete, make your way to the top.

I stayed right of the lichen streak because of its aesthetics. If you decide to use only the face (and not the arete), the difficulty would go up noticeably.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing is good.
content.location: Down climb is on the east side of the boulder.

content.description: Squat start on a crimp four feet above the ground. Move up using positive holds to the massive rail. Utilize the rail to mantle to the top.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter but the landing is great.
content.location: The problem starts on the left side of the west face. The down climb is on the east face.
